messages.title: ACADEMIC AND CAREER HISTORY
messages.content: Graduated from Brunel University in 1994. Elected as a councillor for Barlow Moor ward in 1998. Elected to Parliament in 2005. Fighting for South Manchester for over 20 years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: John successfully campaigned to get the money back to Christie Hospital following the collapse of Icelandic Banks.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Opposing the Closure of Vital Mental Health Services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: John opposed the closure of mental health services and advocated for the alternatives.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Commitment to Those in Desperate Need
keyPolicies.policyDescription: John led City Council’s decision to accept Syrian refugees, ensuring children he has helped are not just election time cases.

issues.government: Providing the real opposition to this Government that the Labour Party is failing to.
issues.health: Working to make sure Manchester’s NHS gets the funding it needs.
issues.immigration: John led City Council’s decision to accept Syrian refugees.

community.content: Fighting to end the neglect of communities across our part of Manchester.

leaflet.personalStatement: I grew up in South Manchester with my mum, dad and sister. My dad was the local Methodist Minister, and I saw each day his drive and commitment to others. I have lived with my partner Catherine for 18 years and want to proudly represent this area in Parliament for 10. I want the opportunity to represent you and work for you but to do that I need your vote on June 8th.

politicalExperience.achievements: Successfully campaigned to get the money back to Christie Hospital. Opposed the closure of mental health services. Led City Council’s decision to accept Syrian refugees.

endorsements.endorsement: When I needed my local MP to help me get the life-saving treatment my young son needed, John was there.
I would urge people in our area to support John. He put us first ahead of anything else.
John was one of the hardest working MPs I have ever had the pleasure to work alongside.

examples: John has helped thousands of people in our area
Providing the real opposition to this Government
He has never stopped changing the lives of people across South Manchester
John has never stopped changing the lives of people
Fighting to end the neglect of communities
Working to make sure Manchester’s NHS gets the funding it needs
A Commitment to Those in Desperate Need - John led City Council’s decision to accept Syrian refugees
